item.title: Is this how i give a lvl 99 stat a auto skill cape?
item.dc:creator: @Rudolph Rudolph
item.description:
@Rudolph wrote:

[quote=“Anti Pizza, post:1, topic:153441”]sendFrame164(6247);
stillgfx(199, absX, absY);
sendFrame126(“Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!”, 548);
sendFrame126(“Your attack level is now “+playerLevel[0]+” .”, 549);
sendMessage(“Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level.”);
NpcDialogueSend = true;
if (playerLevel[0] >= 99) {--------------the skill cape code?
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName +" has just gotten “+ playerLevel[0] +” attack!");
}[/quote]You would need to have the addItem code in there for it to give the skillcape…so make your case look like this:

sendFrame164(6247); stillgfx(199, absX, absY); sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!", 548); sendFrame126("Your attack level is now "+playerLevel[0]+" .", 549); sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level."); NpcDialogueSend = true; if (playerLevel[0] >= 99) {--------------the skill cape code? addItem(ID, AMT); PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName +" has just gotten "+ playerLevel[0] +" attack!"); }

Read full topic
item.source: Is this how i give a lvl 99 stat a auto skill cape?

item.title: Is this how i give a lvl 99 stat a auto skill cape?
item.dc:creator: @Anti_Pizza Anti Pizza
item.description:
@Anti_Pizza wrote:

sendFrame164(6247);
stillgfx(199, absX, absY);
sendFrame126(“Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level!”, 548);
sendFrame126(“Your attack level is now “+playerLevel[0]+” .”, 549);
sendMessage(“Congratulations, you just advanced an attack level.”);
NpcDialogueSend = true;
if (playerLevel[0] >= 99) {--------------the skill cape code?
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName +" has just gotten “+ playerLevel[0] +” attack!");
}
